briefdescription.para: The unique identifier for this action within the context of its owning action set.
Gets the owning action set containing this action.
This property can be used to store whatever arbitrary game data you want on this action.
Gets a value indicating whether this action is listening for new user defined bindings.

Gets the valid (in context of the current device) bindings for this action as a readonly collection. What this means is, if your current active controller is an Xbox One controller and you have InputControlType.Options bound, it will not be included. This is generally the bindings you should display unless you are doing something custom.

Gets ALL bindings for this action (including ones that don't make sense for the current device) as a readonly collection. Use of this collection is not recommended unless you really need unfettered access to all the bindings on an action.

Gets the currently active device (controller) if present, otherwise returns a null device which does nothing. The currently active device is defined as the last device that provided input to this action. When LastInputType is not a device (controller), this will return the null device.

Configures how this action listens for new bindings. When null (default) the owner's PlayerActionSet.ListenOptions will be used.
ListenForBinding()
The binding source type that last provided input to this action.
Updated when LastInputType changes.
The InputDeviceClass of the binding source that last provided input to this action.
The InputDeviceStyle of the binding source that last provided input to this action.
This event is triggered when the binding source type that last provided input to this action changes.
This event is triggered if bindings on an action are added or removed.

memberdef.name: bindingSourceListeners
memberdef.initializer: = { new DeviceBindingSourceListener(), new UnknownDeviceBindingSourceListener(), new KeyBindingSourceListener(), new MouseBindingSourceListener() }

briefdescription.para: Construct an action belonging to a given action set.

parameterdescription.para: A unique identifier for this action within the context of its owning action set.
The action set to contain (own) this action.

briefdescription.para: Adds a default binding for the action. This will also add it to the regular bindings.
A convenience method for adding a KeyBindingSource to the default bindings.

parameterdescription.para: A list of one or more keys making up a KeyCombo for the binding source.

briefdescription.para: A convenience method for adding a KeyBindingSource to the default bindings.

parameterdescription.para: A KeyCombo for the binding source.

briefdescription.para: A convenience method for adding a MouseBindingSource to the default bindings.
A convenience method for adding a DeviceBindingSource to the default bindings.
Add a regular binding to the action. A binding cannot be added if it matches an existing binding on the action, or if it is already bound to another action.

simplesect.para: true, if binding was added, false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Insert a regular binding to the action at the specified index. A binding cannot be inserted if it matches an existing binding on the action, or if it is already bound to another action.

simplesect.para: true, if binding was inserted, false otherwise.

parameterdescription.para: The index at which to insert.

briefdescription.para: Add a regular binding to the action replacing an existing binding. A binding cannot be added if is already bound to another action. If the binding to replace is not present on this action, the binding will not be added.

simplesect.para: true, if binding was added, false otherwise.

parameterdescription.para: The BindingSource to replace it with.

briefdescription.para: Searches all the bindings on this action to see if any that match the provided binding object.

simplesect.para: true, if a matching binding is found on this action, false otherwise.

parameterdescription.para: The BindingSource template to search for.

briefdescription.para: Searches all the bindings on this action to see if any that match the provided binding object and, if found, returns it.

parameterdescription.para: The BindingSource template to search for.

briefdescription.para: Searches all the bindings on this action to see if any that match the provided binding object and, if found, removes it. NOTE: the action is only marked for removal, and is not immediately removed. This is to allow for safe removal during iteration over the Bindings collection.

parameterdescription.para: The BindingSource template to search for.

briefdescription.para: Removes the binding at the specified index from the action. Note: the action is only marked for removal, and is not immediately removed. This is to allow for safe removal during iteration over the Bindings collection.

parameterdescription.para: The index of the BindingSource in the Bindings collection to remove.

briefdescription.para: Clears the bindings for this action.
Resets the bindings to the default bindings.

Begin listening for a new user defined binding. Which types of BindingSource are detected depends on the value of ListenOptions and DefaultListenOptions. Once one is found, it will be added to the regular bindings for the action and listening will stop.

Begin listening for a new user defined binding, replacing an existing specified binding. If the binding to replace is not present on this action, the new binding will fail to be added. Which types of BindingSource are detected depends on the value of ListenOptions and DefaultListenOptions. Once one is found, it will be added to the regular bindings for the action and listening will stop.
Stop listening for new user defined bindings.

Searches all the bindings on this action to see if any that match the provided binding object and, if found, removes it. Unlike RemoveBinding, this immediately removes it from the Bindings collection and updates the visible set. WARNING: This is unsafe to call unless absolutely sure it won't be called while anything is iterating over the Bindings collection.

parameterdescription.para: The BindingSource template to search for.

briefdescription.para: This class represents a single action that may have multiple controls bound to it. A bound control is represented by a subclass of BindingSource. For example, DeviceBindingSource provides input from a control on any supported InputDevice. Similarly, KeyBindingSource provides input from one or more keypresses. An action may have any number of bindings. Actions have two groups of bindings defined: default bindings and regular bindings. Default bindings are the predefined default bindings, and the current bindings for the action can be reset to this group in a single operation. Regular bindings are those added by users, most likely at runtime in a settings menu or the like. There are no other distinctions between these groupings; they are purely for organizational convenience.
